Instrument_description: Questionnaire to assess parental behavior and family discipline, as perceived by the child.

EEG experiment to understand how the connectivity among different areas of the infant brain develops. Infants passively watch 60-second video clips depicting singing women or moving toys.

EEG experiment to understand how the infant brain differentially responds to viewing pictures of faces vs. houses. Infants passively watch pictures of (neutral) faces and pictures of typical Dutch houses.

The PCI consists of age appropriate structured tasks that include a common mildly stressful event (discussing a difficult topic), and a pleasant event (discussing a pleasant topic).
Observation of parent-child interaction with a semi-structured conversational task. Parents and children need to selecta topic of recent disagreement and come up with potential solutions.
Observation of parent-child interaction. Includes a semi-structured conversational task in which parents and children need to cooperate to come up with a plan for a vacation.

Questionnaire about parental behavior consisting of 13-items. Self-report of both parents' and children's perceptions about the behavioral control they experience(d) as children (or control administered to children by their parents).

A measure of sensorimotor ability. Participant needs to move the computer mouse cursor over an ever-shrinking green box and click on it once each time it appears on a different location on the test-page.
Task to assess verbal memory. Consists of 20 target words that are then mixed with 20 distractors equated for frequency, length, concreteness and low imageability.
Task to assess and verbal memory.

Questionnaire to assess personal values. These include values such as, e.g. openess to change, care and security, conservsation and tradition, universalism, dependability, humility, stimulation.
